abstract_ssm: The mission of the Alpha Clerical Union, founded in 1884, was to promote the "spiritual, professional, and social culture and enjoyment of its members." Limited to a total of nine members, the union consisted of ordained ministers of the Reformed Presbyterian Church. These records contain the organization's constitution, bylaws, roll of members, minutes, and financial accounts.
